basics.name: Karlo Benčić
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Dedicated and highly professional development expert with 7+ years of experience in the industry. Specializing in custom software solutions, I have worked as a full-stack .NET engineer in several business domains: gaming industry, government, public transport and have acquired key technical skills such as proficiency in .NET application development, ASP.NET Core and other elements of the .NET ecosystem. I have also proven experience in Java web development, React frontend development, React Native cross-platform development of mobile applications and Unity game development. I combine my academic experience in model-driven architectures and domain-driven methodologies with my entrepreneurial attitude and have deep expertise in back-end systems with a broad knowledge of existing solutions and how they relate to the current technological landscape. My primary professional interest is focus on microservices architectures and supportive technologies such as: Docker, Kubernetes and potential Blockchain implementations setting contemporary software practices - SOLID, DDD, Enterprise integration patterns, Agile, Pull Requests, Code Reviews, QA, CI/CD practices.

projects.name: Distributed Land Registry
projects.summary: Distributed Land Registry solution for Croatia using blockchain technology. All nodes in the network are connected to a Kafka cluster for message queuing and a CouchDB cluster for storing the blockchain data. Nodes have read-only access to the blockchain data and are connected to a Hyperledger Fabric chaincode for managing land registry data, but land owners have write access to their blockchain data using a smart contract written in chaincode with TypeScript and Go. Since every data change is recorded on the blockchain, the data is immutable and cannot be changed.
highlights: Academic project for the university
The solution consists of a web application for managing land registry data and also includes a distributed database for land stored on the blockchain
The solution is implemented on a permissioned blockchain network based on Hyperledger Fabric and also includes a Hyperledger Explorer instance for monitoring the network
The web application is written in NodeJS and uses React for the frontend and Express API for the backend
Land is modeled as a digital asset on the blockchain and consists of a unique ID, owner, area, location, and other data
Everything is deployed as a Docker container

projects.name: DLT Oracle
projects.summary: Decentralized oracle for requesting cryptocurrency market prices. This project implements the possible solution to 'oracle problem', which is one of the biggest problems facing DLT systems based on smart contracts. Furthermore, an in-depth analysis and detailed comparison of existing approaches to solving the oracle problem was carried out with regard to the requirements obtained from the challenge of reliable connection of the blockchain and external data sources. Since the concept of reliability in DLT systems is not adequately solved by cryptographic security, we arrive at the concept of data truthfulness as a new property needed to characterize reliable, decentralized systems. A decentralized oracle makes DLT useful by allowing the entry of non-confidential data into the system in a decentralized manner, without relying on a central entity, which eliminates a single point of failure.
highlights: Academic project as part of my master's thesis
The solution consists of a smart contract for requesting cryptocurrency market prices and a web application for managing the oracle
The smart contract is written in Solidity and uses Chainlink for requesting market prices from external APIs
The web application is written in NodeJS and uses React for the frontend and Web3.js for communicating with the smart contract
Linkpool is used for managing the oracle nodes and LINK token is used for paying the oracle nodes for their work
Everything is deployed as a Docker container
